Bundesliga
Dortmund: Favre reveals his ambitions against Bayern
Borussia Dortmund coach Lucien Favre underlined his players' ambitions for the much-anticipated Bayern matchup this Saturday.
07 Nov 2019, 22:40 by Mourad Bennis



Niko KovacOn post since 2018, Niko Kovac has resigned to its leaders after the heavy disappointment against Frankfurt. Discover the names of his possible successors.Icon Sport

Bayern Munich: the tracks to replace Niko Kovac




Borussia Dortmund's Swiss technician Lucien Favre dreams of winning against Bayern on Saturday. His troops are one point ahead of the Munichers (Dortmund is second with 19 points, one more than Bayern who ranks 4th). In a press conference, he explained the aspirations of his team for the meeting that will take place at the Allianz Arena.

Favre: between optimism and concentration




Lucien Favre + 11 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

Bayern Munich dolphin last season, Borussia will try to take revenge this Saturday. The Bavarians are certainly in trouble, especially after the departure of Nico Kovac. And yet, Lucien Favre knows full well that the task looks difficult. On Thursday, the 62-year-old Swiss said: "If you look at the last five years, it's clear that Borussia Dotmund has always had a hard time going to Munich. nothing to lose (...) We have a lot of respect for Bayern Munich, they have done a lot for the Bundesliga, it is a high level team, but we are not afraid of Bayern. low".
